project.description: Build the docker image for cor-main

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: DRYRUN
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Gather all the parameters for the build and print out the final docker command, but DO NOT run that command.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: GIT_PULL
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: The Dockerfile includes instructions to pull source code from git. This step can be skipped by unchecking this box if the content of the build workspace contains the right source code from the last build attempt.

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: GIT_REPO_URL
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: The git repository from which the build will pull source code.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.CascadeChoiceParame.name: GIT_REF_TYPE
org.biouno.unochoice.CascadeChoiceParame.description: Select how you would like to determine your git commit ID

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' readonly=true name='value' value='error' style='width:400px; font-family:monospace;' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: GIT_COMMIT_ID
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This is the git commit ID that the build will be based on.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' disabled=true style='font-family:monospace; width:400px;'>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: VERSION
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This value reflects the git tag applied to the codebase the docker image will be based on. The git commit may not be the exact commit that was tagged, but would be the most recent commit since that tag before the next tag is encountered. VERSION follows the convention of YYMM.xxxx Example: 1802.0001 This version would specify the January release for 2018 (The month indicates February, but "0001" indicates the very first commit, which the same as the last commit the previous day.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='font-family:monospace; width:400px;'>"

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ECR_REGISTRY_URL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The url of the elastic container registry (ECR) where the newly created image is to be pushed to from this server and pulled from by the target docker host for the new image

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REGISTRY_REPO_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is used to identify the name of the docker registry repository that this image is going to be pushed to. The value is "core" by default, but remember that any feature images should go to a registry repository called "core-feature" Unlike coeus, the docker image for the sandbox environment is no different from any other environment - it is run-time configuration that makes that distinction.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
[ "$VERBOSE" == false ] && set +x
ROOT_DIR='/tmp/krd/core/build.context' if [ ! -d $buildcontext ] ; then echo "ERROR! Cannot find docker build context directory: $ROOT_DIR" exit 1 fi
# Fix the trailing comma issue with active choices parameters reactive GIT_PULL="$(echo $GIT_PULL | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_REF="$(echo $GIT_REF | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_COMMIT_ID="$(echo $GIT_COMMIT_ID | sed 's/,//g')" DRYRUN="$(echo $DRYRUN | sed 's/,//g')" DOCKER_TAG="${ECR_REGISTRY_URL}/${REGISTRY_REPO_NAME}:${VERSION}"
parms=( "interactive=false" "root_dir=$ROOT_DIR" "git_repull=$GIT_PULL" "git_branch=$GIT_REF" "git_refspec=$GIT_COMMIT_ID" "dryrun=$([ "$DRYRUN" == true ] && echo 'true' || echo 'false')" "docker_image_name=$DOCKER_TAG" )
echo "" echo "================================" echo "DOCKER BUILD CONTEXT:" echo "================================"
cd $ROOT_DIR && ls -la
source $ROOT_DIR/docker.sh
build "${parms[@]}"
set -x
